sections.heading: What is Past Tense in Japanese?
sections.content:
Japanese past tense expresses completed actions, past states, and experiences. It's formed by changing verbs and adjectives to their past forms.

食べた "ate" 学生だった "was a student" 楽しかった "was fun"

children.heading: Plain Past (た Form)
children.content: 食べた - ate 行った - went 見た - saw した - did

children.heading: Polite Past (ました Form)
children.content: 食べました - ate (polite) 行きました - went (polite) 見ました - saw (polite) しました - did (polite)

children.heading: 1. Completed Actions
children.content:
Actions that finished in the past:

昨日映画を見た "I watched a movie yesterday" 朝ごはんを食べました "I ate breakfast" 友達に会った "I met a friend" 宿題をした "I did homework"

children.heading: 2. Past States
children.content:
How things were in the past:

昨日は暑かった "It was hot yesterday" 彼は学生だった "He was a student" とても静かでした "It was very quiet" 子供の頃は元気だった "I was energetic when I was a child"

children.heading: 3. Past Experiences
children.content:
Things you've experienced:

日本に行ったことがある "I have been to Japan" 寿司を食べたことがあります "I have eaten sushi" 富士山を見た "I saw Mt. Fuji"

children.heading: 4. Sequential Past Actions
children.content:
One action followed by another:

家に帰って、ご飯を食べた "I went home and ate" シャワーを浴びて、寝ました "I took a shower and slept"

children.heading: Verb Past Forms
children.content: 食べる → 食べた (ate) 行く → 行った (went) 読む → 読んだ (read) 見る → 見た (saw) 来る → 来た (came) する → した (did)

children.heading: I-adjective Past
children.content:
Remove い, add かった:

高い → 高かった (was expensive) 楽しい → 楽しかった (was fun) 大きい → 大きかった (was big) 良い → 良かった (was good) Exception: いい → よかった

children.heading: Na-adjective Past
children.content:
Add だった:

便利 → 便利だった (was convenient) 静か → 静かだった (was quiet) 元気 → 元気だった (was healthy) きれい → きれいだった (was beautiful)

children.heading: Noun + Copula Past
children.content: 学生 → 学生だった (was a student) 先生 → 先生だった (was a teacher) 雨 → 雨だった (it was rain)

children.heading: Verbs
children.content: 食べなかった - didn't eat 行かなかった - didn't go 見なかった - didn't see しなかった - didn't do

children.heading: I-adjectives
children.content: 高くなかった - wasn't expensive 楽しくなかった - wasn't fun 大きくなかった - wasn't big よくなかった - wasn't good

children.heading: Na-adjectives
children.content: 便利じゃなかった - wasn't convenient 静かじゃなかった - wasn't quiet 便利ではなかった (more formal)

children.heading: Nouns
children.content: 学生じゃなかった - wasn't a student 雨じゃなかった - it wasn't rain 学生ではなかった (more formal)

children.heading: Specific Past Times
children.content: 昨日 - yesterday 先週 - last week 去年 - last year さっき - just now 昨日東京に行った "I went to Tokyo yesterday" 先週映画を見ました "I watched a movie last week"

children.heading: Ago (前)
children.content: 3日前 - 3 days ago 1週間前 - 1 week ago 2年前 - 2 years ago 3日前に会った "I met (them) 3 days ago" 2年前に日本に来ました "I came to Japan 2 years ago"

children.heading: Yes/No Questions
children.content: 食べましたか？ "Did you eat?" 昨日行きましたか？ "Did you go yesterday?" 楽しかったですか？ "Was it fun?"

children.heading: With Question Words
children.content: 何を食べましたか？ "What did you eat?" いつ行きましたか？ "When did you go?" どこに行きましたか？ "Where did you go?"

children.heading: Example 1: Weekend
children.content: A: 週末は何をしましたか？ "What did you do on the weekend?" B: 映画を見に行きました "I went to see a movie" A: 面白かったですか？ "Was it interesting?" B: はい、とても面白かったです "Yes, it was very interesting"

children.heading: Example 2: Yesterday
children.content: A: 昨日どこに行った？ "Where did you go yesterday?" B: 友達と買い物に行った "I went shopping with a friend" A: 何を買った？ "What did you buy?" B: 服を買ったよ "I bought clothes"

children.heading: Example 3: Past Experience
children.content: A: 日本に行ったことがありますか？ "Have you been to Japan?" B: はい、去年行きました "Yes, I went last year" A: どうでしたか？ "How was it?" B: とても楽しかったです "It was very fun"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using present for past
children.content: Wrong: 昨日食べる ❌ Right: 昨日食べた ✓ "I ate yesterday"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Wrong past formation
children.content: Wrong: 食べたった ❌ Right: 食べた ✓ "ate" Wrong: 高いかった ❌ Right: 高かった ✓ "was expensive"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Mixing tenses
children.content: Inconsistent: 昨日映画を見て、とても面白いです ⚠️ Better: 昨日映画を見て、とても面白かったです ✓ "I watched a movie yesterday and it was very interesting"

sections.heading: Past Progressive: 〜ていた
sections.content:
For actions that were in progress:

昨日の3時に勉強していた "I was studying at 3 o'clock yesterday" 雨が降っていた "It was raining" テレビを見ていました "I was watching TV"

children.heading: Using て Form
children.content: 朝起きて、顔を洗って、朝ごはんを食べた "I woke up, washed my face, and ate breakfast" 家に帰って、シャワーを浴びて、寝ました "I went home, took a shower, and slept"

children.heading: Using てから (after)
children.content: 宿題をしてから、遊んだ "After doing homework, I played" ご飯を食べてから、出かけました "After eating, I went out"

children.heading: 〜たことがある (have done)
children.content: 寿司を食べたことがある "I have eaten sushi" 富士山に登ったことがあります "I have climbed Mt. Fuji" 日本に行ったことがある？ "Have you been to Japan?"

children.heading: 〜たことがない (have never done)
children.content: 納豆を食べたことがない "I have never eaten natto" スキーをしたことがありません "I have never skied"

children.heading: Used to (よく〜た)
children.content: 子供の頃、よく公園で遊んだ "When I was a child, I often played in the park" 昔はよく本を読んだ "I used to read books often" 学生の時、毎日走りました "When I was a student, I ran every day"

children.heading: Casual (た)
children.content: 食べた "ate" 行った "went" 楽しかった "was fun"

children.heading: Polite (ました/でした)
children.content: 食べました "ate" 行きました "went" 楽しかったです "was fun"

sections.heading: Past Tense in Relative Clauses
sections.content: 昨日見た映画 "the movie (I) watched yesterday" 先週買った本 "the book (I) bought last week" 子供の時に住んでいた家 "the house (I) lived in when (I was) a child"

children.heading: Past Tense in Questions About Now
children.content: お名前は？ "What's your name?" Answer: 田中です (not だった) "I'm Tanaka" Note: Question is casual, but answer uses present

children.heading: Completed Actions
children.content: 昨日映画を見た "I watched a movie yesterday" 朝ごはんを食べました "I ate breakfast" 友達に会った "I met a friend" 宿題をしました "I did homework"

children.heading: Past States
children.content: 昨日は暑かった "It was hot yesterday" 彼は学生だった "He was a student" とても楽しかったです "It was very fun" 静かでした "It was quiet"

children.heading: Negative Past
children.content: 行かなかった "didn't go" 食べませんでした "didn't eat" 高くなかった "wasn't expensive" 学生じゃなかった "wasn't a student"

children.heading: Sequential Actions
children.content: 家に帰って、ご飯を食べて、寝た "I went home, ate, and slept" シャワーを浴びてから、出かけました "After taking a shower, I went out"

children.heading: Past Experience
children.content: 日本に行ったことがある "I have been to Japan" 寿司を食べたことがあります "I have eaten sushi" 富士山を見たことがない "I have never seen Mt. Fuji"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: Present Tense Usage - Non-past forms 〜ていた (te-ita) - Past progressive 〜たことがある - Experience Time Words - Past time expressions Verb Conjugation - た form Te-form - Sequential actions
